name: H10 Marina Barcelona Hotel

reviews.text: My girlfriend and I had the misfortune to experience an horrible stay at the H10 Marina Barcelona from November 25th to November 30th.
reviews.title: Terrible nightmare! And don't expect anything from customer care afterwards

likes.liked: — Personnel was very kind (in loco: on the other side they almost NEVER answer e-mails)
likes.disliked: — Dirty, furniture in bad shape, balcony flooded, shower temperature from freezing to boiling, ants in suite, and so on...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I went to Barcelona for work and my girlfriend joined me 2 days afterwards to celebrate the first anniversary of our relationship, an anniversary that we will surely remember even though not in the positive way we had hoped for.
reviews.title: Good breakfast!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel is not up to four-star standard. Although the staff was for the whole period of the stay very kind and professional, the facilities are to say the least very lacking and made our stay a complete nightmare.
reviews.title: stay here if you can afford it

reviews.text: I work as a junior researcher while my girlfriend is a flight attendant. We are therefore used to constantly travel for work and have been in any kind of hotels all around the world. It was however the first time in our life we had such a terrible experience, having to change the room for four times in just five days!
reviews.title: Not so good as expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will hereby shortly describe the problems which occurred during our stay.
reviews.title: Lame Pool Fee

reviews.text: Stayed at the this hotel for a business conference and it was fine and have stayed in worse. Facilites clean and despite what others have said, found the staff perfectly pleasant, maybe a bit distant but did a professional job. Loved the security guards outfits! The breakfast choices are enormous and fresh but did not eat in the hotel otherwise. Calling the hotel Marina is a slight stretch of the imagination and the marina is really about a 15/20 walk depending on your pace. It's not a location for a rambling stroll but still close enough by taxi or metro to the central area.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in a not great location

reviews.text: I have been to this hotel three times in the last year, mainly for business reasons.
reviews.title: Good hotel - location not that nice

reviews.text: It is a nice 4* hotels with all the amenities you need. Staff is nice and efficient. Not so nice is the fact that you have to pay at the arrival, which I found quite strange.
reviews.title: Good stay, will be happy to stay again

reviews.text: However, rooms are spacious, and very very clean. Some rooms need some more maintainance: in the last one in which I have been the window was not closing properly....luckly outside temperature was perfect. As i said I was there for business reasons, so i did not care about the location with respect to main turistic areas. However if you go there for turistic reasons consider that the area is quite far from the main attractions and that you necessarily need to take the metro to go to the city center (or walk 30-40 minutes to get to the "Born") , also in this area it is quite difficult to find a restaurant (outside the hotel one) to have dinner. So you would need to take the metro also to have a dinner in the city center. On the other hand this make it possible to have a quite good price/quality ratio in comparison to other solutions in Barcelona. In sum if you do not mind taking the metro to visit the city and have a dinner in a good restaurant, this might be a good solution. Otherwise search for something closer to the main attractions area.
reviews.title: First and Best holiday

reviews.text: The hotel is fairly renovated and clean.
reviews.title: European 4 Star Hotel, as advertised

likes.liked: — The warm welcome, and overall appearance on the inside

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 6 months previously we stayed at the H10 Montecada Hotel in the gothic district, which was perfect for a city break, so we didnt hesitate at booking H10 again. We chose this hotel for its location to the beach/marina area. We arrived late Friday night, and reception was very busy, after an initiall mix up over our room (we emailed and paid in advance and notifed the hotel of our late arrival), they insisted thehotel was full, and no double rooms available! However when we showed them the email and the receipt - they backed down). Other than that great hotel, clean modern, nice room/bathrom, fabulous choice at breakfast. This location would suit anyone wanting to be near Barceloneta Beach/Marina/Paseo de Maritim. No good if you want to be in the city centre (although there is metro station very near).
reviews.title: Great Location for the Beach

reviews.text: Taxi's 10 Euros into Las Ramblas, Reception were not helpful in ringing taxis on both occasions we asked them. But Taxis can be flagged down off the main road nearby (may take some time). Overall, a good hotel was everything we expected. LOL! the roof terrace pool was very small. Would stay there again.
reviews.title: Did what it said on the tin!

reviews.text: Not a perfect location if you want to be in Las Ramblas (who wants to go shopping anyway?) as a 10 minute taxi ride into town (about 10 euros) but great for the small Port Olympic with its 7-10 restaurants, casino and small bars.
reviews.title: Great hotel, excellent location

reviews.text: I was with a party of 12 and had a great time.
reviews.title: An average experience

likes.disliked: — Price of car parking and the use of the indoor pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was superb and the rooms were clean with working air con - it was very hot.
reviews.title: not 4 star!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a long story, but this hotel stay was paid by someone else. We were at the H10 Marina for a total of 2 weeks, so we got a thorough idea for the place and all it had to offer. Overall cleanliness of the hotel was excellent. I agree with most other posters that the breakfast selection was beyond what we could have expected- it's definitely worth the additional amount to get the breakfast added as there is a great variety and it's great energy food to get you started on a day of sight-seeing.
reviews.title: If we had been paying, it would have been a disappointment

likes.liked: — Clean, modern and a great breakfast

reviews.text: However, if you get to breakfast after 9, expect to be diappointed as the staff stops refreshing things after that point and everything gets pretty picked over. The food at the hotel (in the restaurant and wine bar) is overpriced, and not very good. But, the marina is just a 15-20 minute walk away with several good restaurants and pubs. Other than that, the hotel is not what I would consider to be "centrally located".
reviews.title: Lovely Location

likes.liked: — Great location close to Marina and beaches
likes.disliked: — Small details in the rooms could be improved.

reviews.text: The staff wasn't really helpful as the bulk of them were non-natives (from Cuba, Uruguay, etc.) who couldn't give any directions on where to go and what to see.
reviews.title: Loved the H10 Marina

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For the prices they charge for this hotel, I would have certainly expected more, but then again, this was my first visit to Barcelona- so it's quite possible my expectations were too high for this very expensive city.
reviews.title: Will Probably Go Elsewhere Next Time

likes.disliked: — Awful beds, they felt like sleeping on concrete!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I walked to the Hotel from the Marina metro station, but it was a bit too far. The Hotels.com site said it was 200 metres, but was more like 400 metres. It's better to use taxis as they are cheap or try another closer metro station (Bogatell), even though it may mean changing trains. On arrival the staff were nice and the hotel was clean and had a nice feel about it. I didn't use the wellness area with the indoor pool. It looked small and was 14 Euros entry fee. The room was a bit small and the TV didn't work so I needed to get that fixed. Like the other reviews, the bed was hard and the bathroom got very wet on the floor when having a shower. The best thing about the Hotel was the location. It's a fairly new area and it was a 5 minute walk to the Marina and the tourist bus stop which was great.
reviews.title: Very happy as well

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked this hotel through Hotwire, but after we found out Hotwire had put us up here, I began to get nervous. I read several negative reviews of the hotel, and they all turned out to be right, unfortunately. The staff was inconsistent at best, at times helpful at times downright rude. They didn't have a room ready for us whenwe arrive to Barcelona, so we had to sit and walk around with no food (no restaurants in the area were open) for several hours, DEAD TIRED, until our room was ready (which was not until after 3 pm!) They weren't even nice about that fact or tried to accomodate us at all!
reviews.title: It might have been a nice boutique hotel...but that was 10 years ago...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: You can tell from the decor that at one time this was a very cute boutique hotel with a very chic design. The problem is, though, that this hotel has not been kept up (lampshades cracked, baseboards highly chipped, and the furniture was all scratched up). Around the time of the 1992 Barcelona Olympics (which is when my partner and I think the hotel was probably built), it was probably a great hotel near Barceloneta port (and it is convenient for that). But now, it's just falling apart.
reviews.title: A Gem in a perfect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The final straw, however was this: The hotel sent us to a restaurant for what the concierge said was the best paella in town. They told the taxi driver where to take us, but he didn't even take us to the right address! Then, when we got where we were going, there wasn't a restaurant in sight! When we brought this matter to the attention of the front desk staff, they became very rude and began to argue with us. We also distinctly heard them curse us under their breath. Their unprofessional behavior was simply inexcusable. Our hotel was the one black eye on an otherwise wonderful trip to Spain. I would never stay here again nor would I ever encourage anyone else to.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, good location with good transport links

reviews.text: We Stayed in the H10 Marina in Barcelona in April 09 and found the Hotel to be magnificant and in this credit crunch times we found it to be really fantastic value for money.
reviews.title: excellent hotel, good breakfast, slighty annoying staff

reviews.text: The rooms are big and have everything in them that you could possibly ask for and as we stayed with breakfast included i have to say that the breakfast was super and there was something for everybody there.
reviews.title: Clean and modern hotel
Good hotel on the whole.
reviews.text: Stayed here mid-March 2004 and was on the whole pretty pleased. For the price the rooms are spacious, well cleaned and freshly designed. Beds are huge, if a little hard for some tastes. Food was excellent, as everyone has already said a massive variety of breakfasts is available.

We ate one evening in the restaurant too, and this was equally impressive.Staff were on the whole very helpful although i was disapointed that the Wellness Centre (spa/pool etc) facilities were not free to all guests (12.50 euros each) and told them as such. Nowhere in their literature does it state that you pay extra for this. Also these facilities are open at pretty useless times if a weekend visitor (1-7pm)The free internet access in the business suite was very useful and the bar/reception area was very pleasant - note the bar is only open until 12 though. As for its location, well we found it perfect.
reviews.title: A good choice
If only the taxi drivers knew the hotel
reviews.text: Metro is a short walk away, quick and reliable. Had no reason to use a cab during our stay. 10 minute walk to the beach / marina (pretty lively at night!) and 15 minutes to the gothic quarter.All in all would recommend this hotel as long as you dont insist on being in the thick of the action or are expecting spa facilities to be included. Loved Barcelona by the way!

We alighted at Bogatell metro station which was a little rough around the edges although, not so much so that I felt intimidated. Upon arrival at the hotel, check-in was swift, the staff were friendly and spoke excellent English, and we were offered glasses of sparkling wine which was a nice touch. (Perhaps I'm easily pleased).
reviews.title: Excellent value, friendly hotel with a touch of luxury

reviews.text: I was in a twin room with a friend/colleague. The room was a fair size, and the air conditioning was very effective. I did think that their Cathode Ray Tube TV could have done with updating to a flat screen as it did look particularly dinosauric sat on the desk. The room was clean. There was a mini-bar which wasn't chilling any of its contents. The bathroom was large. The shower was very powerful, which meant that the screen wasn't very effective. There sink area had an enormous mirror and was well stocked with a good selection of free toiletries. We did occassionally here the voices of people in the next room but no so much so that it was a bother. The free Wi-fi throughout the hotel was a real plus too.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed in H10 Marina Barcelona Hotel for three nights in August 2008 and was rather dissapointed by the experience. I know BCN relatively well, but somehow had managed to imagine this hotel would be ideally located between the beaches and the city center, but it isn't. While the hotel is basically in the midway from Vila Olimpica to the city, the neighbourhood is a bit weary and practically deserted in the evenings. It's a short walk to the nearest metro station Bogatell, but the red metro line that connects directly to the center, has its station (Marina) much further away and particularly in the dark, the walk back to hotel wasn't the most pleasant ever.
reviews.title: Business hotel in the middle of nothing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service at the front desk upon arrival was friendly and welcoming, the complimentary glass of cava was tasty and there's a bar in the lobby serving coffee and pastries that can substitute for their expensive breakfast. The rooftop sundeck and pool is a nice thought, but in practise we never had a chance to really enjoy it, as all the chairs and beach towels run out after just first ten or so hotel guests.
reviews.title: nice hotel poor air conditioning

reviews.text: The room itself was spacious and very business like, but I've never slept on a harder bed in my life; it was like sleeping on a pile of two-by-fours. The bathroom was all marble or something and very clean, but every time we shut the bathroom door, the ceiling panelling trembled like it might come down. Room's soundproofing could have been better too, this is a four star hotel after all. All in all, though we did continue our stay in BCN, we decided not to stay at H10 Marina any longer and changed hotel.
reviews.title: Terrible location and worse service!

reviews.text: we stayed hear for three nights in early july we had a junior suit with a balcony mainly so my wife could have a smoke it cost about 400 quid i think they may have put the breakfast price down as it was only 10 euros each the room was big and nice enough but air conditioning was very poor even in this top range room we had to open the big door onto the balcony at night to get some cool air but then the mosquitos came in and bit us so we could not win but all in all made the most of it , we walked down to the marina most nights only 15 minutes away and ate in the nice marina front restaurants i think i would recommend hotel but warn about poor air conditioning
reviews.title: More than I expected

reviews.text: Calling this hotel the Marina Barcelona is a joke. It is a cab ride away from the marina and over a ten euro cab ride to get anywhere of interest. The staff at this hotel is rude and very unhelpful. Finding a hotel for the perfect stay in Barcelona is all about location and this is NOT it. Look elsewhere.
reviews.title: Avoid this hotel in Barcelona !

reviews.text: Couldn't fault the service! All staff courteous and helpful . Superb breakfast buffet including bucks fizz if you want it! Had balcony room at the front with panoramic views of city attractions, spectacular when lit up at night. Rooms were clean, comfortable and functional. Loved the quieter location near Blue Bus Route pick-up points, beach, restaurants, Casino and the Zoo at Ciutadella Park. Felt safe walking back at night. Taxis nearby, easy to hail, reasonable fares to city sights. Would definitely stay again and recommend to others. So much to see and do in Barcelona - would never tire of returning!
reviews.title: Great Place to Stay for a Barcelona Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OK well the hotel was clean and tidy, smart and classy in fact. The staff were friendly and helpfull. The location was great for us, we didn't want to be in the centre of Las Ramblas but not a million miles away either. The hotel is a 5 min walk to the casino and all the wonderfull seafood restaurands around it..
reviews.title: Great location for the beach and a 20 min walk into the centre.

likes.disliked: — price of a san miguel ! 3 euros !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2004, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel swimming pool is not big by any stretch of the imagination however it does have a good feel to it and the barmen are great, this said you have to get in early to grab a sunbed as there is only room for 10-15 ! I thought that the charge to use the well being centre was a bit steep but I only used it once so wasn't to bothered.
reviews.title: Clean tidy and adequate

reviews.text: The breakfast is great with plenty of varienty including fresh fruits, cereals and cooked foods available.
reviews.title: Great hotel - will go back again

reviews.text: I stayed here a few years ago (sorry for the delay!) on what was my second visit to beautiful Barcelona. This hotel is a good clean hotel with nice tidy modern rooms, everything works and the staff are efficient if not over friendly. I am amazed at some of the reviews in here that have been quite negative and i believe that if you are nice to people they will respond in the same way! A great location for the beach and marina, taxis are easy to get, just flag one down for yourself instead of asking for help all the time, and so what if it costs ten euros to get into town!! Its no big deal, try catching a cab in london......! This is an ideal base for those seeking mid range accomodation, would i go back? Yes i would.
reviews.title: H10, hotel with charm and a personality of a dishwasher..

reviews.text: A very good hotel. Stayed there for 2 weeks.
reviews.title: Very Good Hotel

likes.liked: — Very clean. Free WiFi. Amazing breakfast. Good location. A/C.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good location to explore all of Barcelona on foot. A few minutes walking from the beaches, Port Olimpic, Metro, buses etc.
reviews.title: Not great - but above average

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A huge breakfast every morning.
reviews.title: Very happy

likes.disliked: — spa and treatments were expensive, outdoor pool was only open until 6pm

reviews.text: Very clean. Room somewhat small.
reviews.title: A 3 to 4 star hotel

description: Standing in a ideal location in the Villa Olímpica neighbourhood, close to the beaches and next to the city centre.The H10 Marina Barcelona is a unique hotel thanks to its range of services and facilities which include its Skyline terrace with pool and spectacular views of the city, its Despacio Spa Centre, its Dionissos Restaurant with signature cuisine, its spacious multi-purpose meeting rooms and Privilege, Exclusive Rooms and Services.
